trans-unit.source: Discard a card: Putrid Imp gains flying until end of turn. Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Putrid Imp gets +1/+1 and can't block.

trans-unit.source: When Terastodon enters the battlefield, you may destroy up to three target noncreature permanents. For each permanent put into a graveyard this way, its controller puts a 3/3 green Elephant creature token onto the battlefield.

trans-unit.source: No one has properly answered her favorite riddle: "Why should I spare your life?"

trans-unit.source: "Into its maw went the seventh sea, never to be seen again while the world remains."\n—Esper fable

trans-unit.source: "Through the haze of battle I saw the glint of sun on golden mane, the sheen of glory clad in mail, and I dropped my sword and wept at the idiocy of war."\n—Dravin, Gruul deserter

trans-unit.source: Name a nonland card. Target player reveals his or her hand and discards all cards with that name. Flashback— Sacrifice a creature. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

trans-unit.source: A grave is the safest place to store ill-gotten treasures.

trans-unit.source: Enchant creature card in a graveyard When Animate Dead enters the battlefield, if it's on the battlefield, it loses "enchant creature card in a graveyard" and gains "enchant creature put onto the battlefield with Animate Dead." Return enchanted creature card to the battlefield under your control and attach Animate Dead to it. When Animate Dead leaves the battlefield, that creature's controller sacrifices it. Enchanted creature gets -1/-0.
trans-unit.target: Enchant creature card in a graveyard When Animate Dead enters the battlefield, if it's on the battlefield, it loses "enchant creature card in a graveyard" and gains "enchant creature put onto the battlefield with Animate Dead." Enchanted creature gets -1/-0.

trans-unit.source: When Diabolic Servitude enters the battlefield, return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
